title: Adulting on the Spectrum: Why I got the COVID vaccine
cleaned_text:
Hosts, Andrew Komarow and Eileen Lamb, speak with Katie Santoro, who decided to get the COVID-19 vaccine because of her love of travel. Katie struggled to find her niche in the working world. She was diagnosed with autism at 24. Her diagnosis put her on a path to being an autism advocate. She is president of the Unicorn Children's Foundation Junior board, as well as being president for UCF. She is a contributing member for the Els for Autism and Center for Autism at University of Miami. Her life goal is to travel all seven continents.

Subscribe at the below platforms to get new episodes as they are released:
• Information about the COVID-19 vaccine for adults with autism
• For comments and suggestions, email us at podcast@autismspeaks.org

The views and opinions expressed in this podcast are those of the hosts and guests and do not necessarily reflect the views of Autism Speaks.
